Messages of Sympathy from S. Korea
    Pyongyang, May 15 (KCNA) -- Messages of sympathy came to the National Reconciliation Council of Korea,  the Korean Social Democratic Party, the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, the Korean Student Committee, the North Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification, the National Economic Cooperation Federation, the Central Committee of the Korean Catholic Association, the Korean Democratic Women's Union and  the Association of Korean Women from different organizations in the south in connection with the recent accident in Ryongchon County, North Phyongan Province.
 The addressers included the south Korean Catholic Farmers' Association, the south Korean Federation of Fellow Countrymen for Inheriting Paekbom's Spirit, the south Korean Catholic Priests' Association for Justice, the Asian Council of Religionists for Peace in south Korea, the Committee of Major Catholic Church for National Reconciliation in south Korea, the south Korean Council of Religionists for Peace, the Seoul District Catholic Committee for National Reconciliation, the south Korean All-People Council for National Reconciliation and Cooperation, the South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification, the Organization to Honor the Memory of Late Spring Rev. Mun Ik Hwan for National Reunification in south Korea, the south Korean Youth Council, the south Korean Foundation for South-North Economic and Cultural Cooperation, the  Headquarters of the Movement of Jeju Islanders for South-North Cooperation, the south Korean Women's Council for Peace, the south Korean Federation of Women's Organizations and other organizations and public figures in south Korea and the Japan Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification (Pomminryon), the Federation of South Koreans in Japan for Democracy and Unification and the U.S. Headquarters of Pomminryon.    
 Extending deep sorrow and sympathy to the compatriots in the north over the accident, the messages expressed the belief that the compatriots in the north would bravely overcome this disaster with an indomitable will and persevering efforts and called on all the fellow countrymen to display the might of the great national unity with warm compatriotic feelings.

Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of KPA General
    Pyongyang, May 15 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il Saturday sent a wreath to the bier of KPA General Won Ung Hui, member of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, expressing deep condolences over his death.
